lg.l: To a Friend who Married a shrew
By Dean Swift
Nell scolded in so loud a Din,
That Will dust hardly Venture in:
He mark'd the Conjugal Dispute;
Nell roars incessant, Dick sat Mute:
But, when he saw his friend Appear,
Cry'd bravely, Patience, good my Dear.
At sight of Will She brawl'd no more,
But Hurry'd out & Clapt the Door.Why Dick! the Devill's in thy Nell,
Quoth Will; thy house is worse than Hell:
Why, what a Peal the jade has rung!
Damn her, Why Don't You slit her Tongue?
For nothing else could make cease:
Dear Will, I suffer this for Peace;
I never quarrel with my Wife:
I bear it for A quiet Life.
Scripture You know Exorts us to it;
Bids us seek Peace and ensue it.Will went again to Visit Dick;
And Ent'ring in the Very Nick,
He saw Virago Nell belabour,
Wtḥ Dicks own staff, his peaceful Neighbour,
Poor Will, who needs must Interpose,
Received a brace or two of Blows.But now to make my story short,
Will drew out Dick to take a quart.
Why Dick, thy Wife has Dev'lish Whims;
Ods buds, Why don't You break her Limbs?
If she were mine, and had such Tricks,
I'd teach her how to handle sticks:
Z──ds I wou'd ship her for Jamaica,
And truck the Carrion for Tobacco;
I'd send her far Enough away──
Dear Will; but what wou'd People say?
Lord! I shou'd get so ill a name,
The Neighbours round wou'd cry out Shame:Dick suffer'd for his peace & Credit;
But, Who believ'd him when he said it?
Can he who makes himself a slave
Consult his Peace, or Credit save?
Dick found it by his ill Success:
His quiet small, his Credit less.
She serv'd him at the Usual rate;
She stun'd, and then She broke his pate.
And what he thought the Hardest Case;
The Parish jeer'd him to his face;
Those men who wore the Breeches least,
Call'd him a Cuckold, fool, and Beast.
At home he was Persu'd with Noise;
Abroad was Pester'd with the Boys.
Within his wife wou'd Break his Bones,
Without they Pelted him With Stones:
The Prentices Procured a Riding,
To act his Patience, and her Chiding.False Patience, & Mistaken Pride,
There are ten thousand Dicks beside:
Slaves to their quiet and good Name,
Are Used like Dick, and bear the Blame.219-135F
